data.message: I love Facebook with out you i can't always communicate my friends and relatives, ,,

replies.message: You're making us blush, Cecil! Thank you for your kind words. Stay awesome! -Chantal

Yes, you can, Gabriel, but sometimes schedules conflict, lives are busy, you just want to share something you found online, or you think of something when you know others are sleeping or at work; and then you can send a message for them to see when they are able. Having new forms of communication is a good thing!
I came from Philippines and it cost lot's of money just to talk to them.

I recently discovered family in other countries that I'd only heard stories about. Since families in different countries don't always get to tell everyone when somebody has died, they family tree is lost and complicated. Not long ago Facebook helped us reconnect with our family and learn more about people as close as deceased parents or grandparents:) Don't see tweeting helping me with that experience lol
Thanks Sabrina Ross yuor so nice...
